poem:
Transnational Shadows

In the halls of learning,  
where ideas should soar,  
silence looms heavy—  
a dragon at the door.  

Words are restrained,  
bending beneath unseen chains.  
Voices, once a vibrant tide,  
now whisper, seeking shadows to hide.  

In the land of free discourse,  
freedom pays its cost.  
Who tends the flame when voices are lost?
